net.sandius.rembulan

Class Arithmetic

  • java.lang.Object
    • net.sandius.rembulan.Arithmetic

  • public abstract class Arithmetic
extends Object
    A representation of one of the two arithmetic modes (integer or float).

    This class serves as a bridge between the representation of Lua numbers as Number and the appropriate dispatch of arithmetic operations via the methods of LuaMathOperators.

    There are two concrete instances of this class, FLOAT (the float arithmetic) and INTEGER (the integer arithmetic). In order to obtain the correct instance for the given numbers, use the static methods of(Number, Number) (for lookup based on two arguments, i.e. for binary operations) or of(Number) (for lookup based on a single argument, i.e. for unary minus).

    The arithmetic methods of this class yield boxed results.

    Example: Given two objects a and b of type Number, use the Arithmetic class to compute the value of the Lua expression (a // b):

       // Number a, b
   final Number result;
   Arithmetic m = Arithmetic.of(a, b);
   if (m != null) {
       result = m.idiv(a, b);
   }
   else {
       throw new IllegalStateException("a or b is nil");
   }

    • Field Detail

      • INTEGER

        public static final Arithmetic INTEGER
        Integer arithmetic.

        Invokes arithmetic operations from LuaMathOperators with all arguments converted to Lua integers (i.e. longs).

      • FLOAT

        public static final Arithmetic FLOAT
        Float arithmetic.

        Invokes arithmetic operations from LuaMathOperators with all arguments converted to Lua floats (i.e. doubles).

        NullPointerException - if a or b is null

      • of

        public static Arithmetic of(Number a,
                            Number b)
        Return an arithmetic based on the concrete types of the arguments a and b.

        If either of a or b is null, returns null. Otherwise, if either of a or b a Lua float, returns FLOAT. If a and b are both Lua integers, returns INTEGER.

        Parameters:
        a - first argument, may be null
        b - second argument, may be null
        Returns:
        null if a or b is null; FLOAT if a or b is a Lua float; INTEGER if a and b are Lua integers

      • of

        public static Arithmetic of(Number n)
        Return an arithmetic based on the concrete type of the argument n. If n is null, returns null; otherwise, returns FLOAT if n is a Lua float, or INTEGER if n is a Lua integer.
        Parameters:
        n - the argument, may be null
        Returns:
        null if n is null; FLOAT if n is a Lua float; INTEGER if n is a Lua integer
